title.value: Regulation of the growth processes of meadow plant communities

person.name: Biryukovich, A.L., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute for Land Reclamation

abstract.value: The results of the studying of the influence of processing technologies on the vegetation processes of plant formations of perennial grasses are presented in the article. It is established that productivity of cereals and cereal-legume perennial grasses at the 4th-hay cutting is higher than at the 2nd- hay cutting. Clover (Trifolium repens) and birds-foot trefoil (Lotus corniculatus) in one-specific cropping form higher productivity at the 4th-hay cutting than at the 2nd -hay cutting on 32 and 22% respectively. Application of nitric supplementary fertilizers (N20 and N40) minimizes the difference. Creeping alfalfa (Medicago sativa) represents higher stability and crop yield level. Allelopathic activity of the soil of rhizosphere of cereal-legume and leguminous grasses of the first year stands stable. Rhizosphere of Lucerne represents higher allelopathic activity than of clover and birds-foot trefoil.
